thread.title: NASCAR Kansas 2015: Start time, lineup, TV/radio schedule and more
thread.title_full: NASCAR Kansas 2015: Start time, lineup, TV/radio schedule and more

title: NASCAR Kansas 2015: Start time, lineup, TV/radio schedule and more
text:
USA TODAY Sports' Jeff Gluck breaks down the Hollywood Casino 400. USA TODAY Sports
Ryan Newman (Photo: Jasen Vinlove, USA TODAY Sports)
1 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE KANSAS CITY, Kan. — It's NASCAR race day at Kansas Speedway, and we've got some essential information you need to get ready for Sunday’s Hollywood Casino 400.
START TIME: Mark-Paul Gosselaar, star of NBC television’s “Truth Be Told,” is scheduled to instruct drivers to start their engines at 2:22 p.m. (ET) today. If you want to skip the pre-race show and just tune in for the race, turn on your TV at 2:31 p.m. for the green flag.
USA TODAY
James: Kyle Busch on Chase: entertaining doesn't mean fair
RACE DISTANCE: The Hollywood Casino 400, the second of two Sprint Cup races this season at Kansas Speedway, is 267 laps around the 1.5-mile track for a total of 400 miles.
USA TODAY
Once the Chase favorites, Joe Gibbs Racing carries mixed bag into Kansas
NATIONAL ANTHEM: Gracie Schram, a resident of Leawood, Kan., will perform the national anthem.
TV/RADIO SCHEDULE: NBC will broadcast today's race. The pre-race show is scheduled at 1:30 p.m. The Motor Racing Network will call the race on the radio.
WEATHER: Today’s forecast is picture perfect – a high of 70 with sunny skies and almost no chance of rain.
USA TODAY
Dale Earnhardt Jr. flummoxed by his stats on 1.5-mile tracks
LAST TIME: Joey Logano won last year’s fall race at Kansas. The Kyles – Larson and Busch – followed in second and third, respectively.
STARTING LINEUP: Brad Keselowski won the pole Friday with a speed of 195.503 mph. Following in the top five on today’s starting grid will be Carl Edwards, Kyle Busch, Kevin Harvick and Denny Hamlin.
Today's lineup at the 1.5-mile Kansas Speedway (car number in parentheses):
